蝞蝞蝞

蝞字的基本解释

蝞
mèi
一种像虾的水生动物，寄居龟壳中，肉可以食用。

蝞字的汉语字典释义

[①]［mèi］
［《廣韻》明祕切，去至，明。］
寄生龟壳中的介虫。似虾。传说食之益人颜色。别名寄居。

蝞字的康熙字典解释

【申集中】【虫字部】　蝞； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页1090第01
【唐韻】【集韻】?明祕切，音媚。【廣韻】蝞似蝦，寄生龜殻中，食之益人顏色。【郭璞·江賦】蜦䗚鱟蝞。【註】蝞，食之顏色有愛媚。【唐書·廢后王氏傳】武才人誣后與母挾蝞道蠱上，帝信之，下詔廢后。

蝞字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体韩国明朝体
蝞字的起名意思

寄生龟壳中的介虫。似虾。传说食之益人颜色。别名寄居。

Moth
Basic explanation of words
Moth
mèi
A shrimp-like aquatic animal that lives in the shell of a tortoise and its meat is edible.
Moth
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［mèi］
["Guangyun" Ming secretly cuts, goes to the end, Ming. ]
Insects in parasitic tortoise shells. Like shrimp. Legend has it that food is beneficial to people. Alias sojourn.
Moth
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Shenzhen Collection] [Insect Character Department] 　蝞; Kangxi Strokes: 15; Page Number: Page 1090 Page 01
[Tang Yun] [Ji Yun]? Ming and secret, charming sound. [Guangyun] The moth resembles a shrimp, in the shell of a parasitic tortoise, the color of food is beneficial to people. [Guo Pu·Jiang Fu] Canthus limulus. [Note] Mot, the color of food is charming. [Book of Tang·Wang's Biography of the Abandoned Queen] The Wucai man falsely accused the empress and the mother to hold the worm, and the emperor believed it, and issued an edict after the abolishment.
Moth

Moth
Name meaning
Insects in parasitic tortoise shells. Like shrimp. It is said that the color of food is beneficial to people. Alias sojourn.
mèi
(Cant.) 塘蝞, dragonfly
